channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken tree branch poses danger to pedestrians, 22nd June
item.description:
A tree branch just snapped due to wind and now it's swinging. It poses a threat to pedestrians underneath.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Balmes Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of cardboard boxes stacked upon each other blocking the entire pathway, 22nd June
item.description:
Pile of cardboard boxes stacked upon each other blocking the pavement with additional plastic furniture etc piled up

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bullace Row, Camberwell, London

item.title: Restaurant rubbish, 22nd June
item.description:
15 bags of various rubbish Why is area out side our work. Soho recovery centre now a rubbish collection point. Why are all the businesses putting rubbish outside our door. It’s grim every day. shops are dumping outside our door. It’s got to stop

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Manette Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trolly and bags of dumped rubbish, 22nd June
item.description:
Happens at least once a month. As I have suggested in previous reports this seriously needs investigation who is doing this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowford Close, Thamesmead, London

item.title: The water belonging to the site remains open for hours, 22nd June
item.description:

item.title: Unsecured bin area,, 22nd June
item.description:
The landlord has adviced us to contact you regarding this issue which has been the source of discomfort, stress and disgust for a very long time. Residents and others use this area to dump their rubish, fly tippers also abuse it and this is creating a hazardous situation. Pests and flies are everywhere, endangering our lives.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Matfield Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked blocking footway, cycle lane, 22nd June
item.description:
Every weekend cars park here, blocking the footway and the cycle path and damaging the verge. It seems that because it is mostly at the weekends, no enforcement action is ever taken

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Enfield Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Giant litter pile growing every week, 22nd June
item.description:
Dumping in communal space. Mountain of trash still growing, includes all types of objects from furniture to food. Building landlord is aware but hasn't taken responsibility. Second time reporting to council, don't know who else can help. Unsafe space

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped gas canister., 22nd June
item.description:
Someone has fly-tipped some kind of gas canister behind our front garden wall. We do not own a vehicle so cannot take it to the local tip. And we cannot put it in our domestic waste bins because we do not know if it is empty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Flaxton Road, Plumstead, London
